provenance.title: How to disable parallel tool calling | 🦜️🔗 LangChain

sections.heading_text: How to disable parallel tool calling | 🦜️🔗 LangChain

blocks.text: This API is currently only supported by OpenAI and Anthropic.

OpenAI tool calling performs tool calling in parallel by default. That means that if we ask a question like "What is the weather in Tokyo, New York, and Chicago?" and we have a tool for getting the weather, it will call the tool 3 times in parallel. We can force it to call only a single tool once by using the parallel_tool_call parameter.
First let's set up our tools and model:

blocks.code: from langchain_core.tools import tool@tooldef add(a: int, b: int) -> int:    """Adds a and b."""    return a + b@tooldef multiply(a: int, b: int) -> int:    """Multiplies a and b."""    return a * btools = [add, multiply]

import osfrom getpass import getpassfrom langchain.chat_models import init_chat_modelif "OPENAI_API_KEY" not in os.environ:    os.environ["OPENAI_API_KEY"] = getpass()llm = init_chat_model("openai:gpt-4.1-mini")

blocks.text: Now let's show a quick example of how disabling parallel tool calls work:

blocks.code: llm_with_tools = llm.bind_tools(tools, parallel_tool_calls=False)llm_with_tools.invoke("Please call the first tool two times").tool_calls

blocks.text: As we can see, even though we explicitly told the model to call a tool twice, by disabling parallel tool calls the model was constrained to only calling one.
